{"step_by_step_thinking": "Vitamin K antagonists are substances that reduce blood clotting by reducing the action of vitamin K. They are used as anticoagulant medications in the prevention of thrombosis. This means they work against the production of clotting factors by the liver, which is the opposite of what Vitamin K does. Therefore, Vitamin K itself would promote the production of clotting factors by the liver, not antagonize it.", "answer_choice": "D. Production of clotting factors by liver"}
